Executive Summary
The Himolde Study Friend project aims to centralize course data, provide instant and accurate answers to student queries, and enhance the student experience. This initiative will save students time, reduce repetitive questions for staff, and lay the groundwork for future expansions. docs/prd.md Product Requirements Document
Functional Requirements
FR13: The user can interact with the chatbot through a web-based interface. FR14: The web interface shall be responsive and work on both desktop and mobile browsers. docs/architecture.md Architecture
Executive Summary
The Himolde Study Friend project aims to centralize course information through an AI-powered chatbot. The architecture will be kept simple with one backend service and a single knowledge base, supported by a manual or simple import pipeline. Streaming responses will be used to provide immediate user feedback. docs/architecture.md Architecture
Project Initialization
Project initialization will involve a sequence of commands to set up the Vite + React (TypeScript) frontend, integrated with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui. This includes npm create vite, cd, npm install, install Tailwind, initialize Tailwind, install @types/node, and initialize shadcn/ui. docs/architecture.md Architecture
Decision Summary
Frontend: Vite + React (TS), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui. Build Tooling: Vite/Rollup. Project Structure: Vite default. Quality: Vitest for frontend, ESLint + Prettier for frontend. docs/architecture.md Architecture
Project Structure
Details the folder structure for frontend (Vite + React (TypeScript) SPA), backend (Python REST API), docs, and CI/CD (.github/workflows/). This story directly establishes these foundational directories. docs/architecture.md Architecture
Epic to Architecture Mapping
Story 1.1: Project Initialization & CI/CD Pipeline Setup maps to `frontend/`, `backend/`, `.github/workflows/`. This section outlines which parts of the architecture are touched by this specific story. docs/architecture.md Architecture
Technology Stack Details
Core Technologies: Frontend (Vite, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Backend (Python, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, pgvector). AI (Gemini API). docs/architecture.md Architecture
Implementation Patterns
Naming Conventions: Frontend (PascalCase for Components, camelCase for Variables/Functions, Files match component name). Code Organization: Frontend (by feature for pages/major components, reusable UI in components/, utilities/API client in lib/, styles in styles/). docs/architecture.md Architecture
Deployment Architecture
Frontend (Vite React SPA) will be deployed on Vercel, and the backend service (Python REST API with PostgreSQL) will be deployed on Railway. This provides developer-friendly, managed hosting solutions. docs/architecture.md Architecture
Development Environment
Prerequisites: Node.js, Python, Git, Docker (optional). Setup Commands: Frontend (`cd frontend`, `npm install`, `npm run dev`), Backend (`cd backend`, `python -m venv venv`, `pip install -r requirements.txt`, `uvicorn main:app --reload`). docs/ux-design-specification.md UX Design Specification
Design System Foundation
shadcn/ui (v0.8.0) chosen for its strong alignment with the project's need for a minimal, highly customizable, accessible, and trustworthy chat interface. Integration with Tailwind CSS offers granular control over styling. docs/ux-design-specification.md UX Design Specification
Responsive Design & Accessibility
The application will provide a seamless and intuitive experience across various devices. WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance is targeted, ensuring the application is inclusive and usable for all students. docs/epics.md Epic Breakdown
Epic 1: Foundation & Core Chat Interface
Goal: Establish the essential technical foundation, a structured knowledge base, and a working, responsive chat UI. This delivers the visible application and the backend structure needed for all future functionality. docs/epics.md Epic Breakdown
Story 1.1: Project Initialization & CI/CD Pipeline Setup (MVP)
As a Developer, I want a standardized project structure and an automated CI/CD pipeline, So that I can ensure consistent development practices and reliable deployments. This section also lists the Acceptance Criteria for Story 1.1. Frontend Framework: Vite + React (TypeScript) Styling: Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui Frontend Testing Framework: Vitest Frontend Linting/Formatting: ESLint + Prettier Build Tooling: Vite/Rollup Project Structure: Vite default for frontend CI/CD: GitHub Actions for automation (linters and basic tests) Backend Testing Framework: Pytest Backend Linting/Formatting: Black + Flake8 Frontend Deployment: Vercel Backend Deployment: Railway Frontend Naming Conventions: React Components: PascalCase, Variables/Functions: camelCase, Files match component name Backend Naming Conventions: Variables/Functions: snake_case, Classes: PascalCase, Files/Modules: snake_case Code Organization: Frontend by feature (pages/, components/, lib/, styles/), Backend by type/domain (api/, services/, models/, core/, db/, rag/) Error Handling: Frontend Error Boundary, Backend consistent HTTP status codes and JSON error objects Logging: Python's built-in logging module to console (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR levels) Data Architecture: PostgreSQL API Contracts: REST, SSE/HTTP for chat streaming Security: Dedicated DB user, HTTPS for all traffic, secure environment variables, AI safety Performance: Vercel CDN, PostgreSQL indexing, streaming responses for perceived speed Development Environment Prerequisites: Node.js, Python, Git Frontend testing will utilize Vitest, following modern JavaScript/TypeScript testing practices. Initial setup will involve basic unit tests. Backend testing will use Pytest. CI/CD structure for future monorepo evolution, and test coverage strategy have been noted as low-severity findings.

**Outcome**: Approve

**Key Findings**:
*   **LOW Severity**: TypeScript Configuration Workaround. The `tsconfig.json` was consolidated as a workaround for `shadcn/ui` CLI. (File: `himolde-study-friend/tsconfig.json`)
*   **LOW Severity**: CI/CD Structure for Monorepo. The `frontend-ci.yml` is within `himolde-study-friend`, which might need refactoring to a root `.github/workflows` when the project becomes a monorepo. (File: `himolde-study-friend/.github/workflows/frontend-ci.yml`)
*   **LOW Severity**: Initial Test Coverage. The current tests are basic examples and not comprehensive. (Files: `himolde-study-friend/src/App.test.tsx`, `himolde-study-friend/src/setupTests.ts`)

**Acceptance Criteria Coverage**:
*   AC#1: IMPLEMENTED - Standard folder structure created.
    *   Evidence: `himolde-study-friend/src/`, `himolde-study-friend/public/`, `himolde-study-friend/.github/workflows/`
*   AC#2: IMPLEMENTED - `package.json` with core dependencies created.

*   AC#3: IMPLEMENTED - Basic "Hello World" app runs locally.
    *   Evidence: `npm run dev` output `Local: http://localhost:5173/`
*   AC#4: IMPLEMENTED - CI/CD pipeline configured for linters and tests on push.
    *   Evidence: `himolde-study-friend/.github/workflows/frontend-ci.yml`

**Task Completion Validation**:
*   20 of 20 completed tasks verified. 0 questionable, 0 falsely marked complete. All tasks were properly completed.

**Test Coverage and Gaps**:
*   Basic unit test for `App` component is present (`himolde-study-friend/src/App.test.tsx`).
*   No other tests for other components or integrations, which is expected for this foundational story.

**Architectural Alignment**:
*   Fully aligned with `docs/architecture.md` and `docs/sprint-artifacts/tech-spec-epic-1.md`. Frontend framework, styling, testing, linting, build tooling, project structure, and CI/CD all conform to the specified architecture.

**Security Notes**: No security vulnerabilities introduced.

**Best-Practices and References**:
*   `shadcn/ui` initialization guide: `https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/installation/vite`

- Note: As the project evolves into a monorepo, refactor CI/CD pipelines to a root-level `.github/workflows/` and use path filtering for `frontend/` changes. (File: `himolde-study-friend/.github/workflows/frontend-ci.yml`)
